intro: Margarospermum arvense, commonly known as the field margarospermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to temperate regions of Asia and is often found growing in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in fields. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Margarospermum arvense is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters.
